intro: Elaphoglossum crassicaule, commonly known as the broad-stemmed holly fern, is a member of the Dryopteridaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a small to medium-sized fern characterized by its dense, evergreen fronds that are typically arching or spreading. The plant has a short, stout rhizome and produces fertile fronds with sporangia on the underside of the pinnae. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a distinctive, intricate structure with serrated margins. Elaphoglossum crassicaule thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
